critique: This executive order focuses on preserving historic properties owned by the Federal Government and promoting partnerships with state and local governments, Indian tribes, and the private sector for their preservation and use. It emphasizes intergovernmental cooperation and aims to integrate historic preservation objectives into agency program activities. The order also encourages heritage tourism and economic development related to historic properties, while ensuring that national and homeland security considerations are not compromised. It does not create any new enforceable rights or benefits.
